content.description: One of the best V5s at Hueco.  Don't be deceived by starting at the constriction between the floor and roof - look down into the dark depths for the real start.  This climbs over 30 ft and you can step off at almost any point!   Start all the way at the back moving a bit left then back right into the ass-dragger constriction and a rest.  Continue up the face with a heart-breaker pinch near the end.
content.protection: 2 pads recommended down low, at least one at the main level and two over the boulders for the upper face.  Something thin might be nice for the hard moves at the constriction.

content.description: This problem is decievingly difficult and without perfect beta may feel many times harder than Star Power despite having the same grade.  Start low and right in a large heuco, and figure out how to move left on the wall through an undercling.  Make a hard dynamic move to a pretty good crimp and make another big move before topping out on easier but chossy ground.  Fun movement but the rock is extremely sharp.
content.location: Far left side of the Star Power wall.  About 25 ft left of Star Power, you will pass this climb on the approach to Star Power.

content.description: Start matched on a good fin a little higher and 8 or so feet left of the start for Star Power.  Head up then right on crimps with the final hard move to gain a big hueco in Star Power after the constriction.  Finish out on Star Power.
content.protection: A couple pads low and a thin one at the constriction.  Another on the boulder for the top of Star Power wouldn't be a bad idea.
content.location: Down in the hole left of Star Power.

content.description: Home to just 4 problems from V5 to V10 with the classic name-sake climb coming out the long juggy roof.  Well worth a visit if on tour in the area
